Created an attachment (id=26929)
TestAddress.wsdl

I used the attached wsdl to create the Java skeleton Web Service and invoked
the echoAddress which will take this SoapElement: 
<q0:echoAddress xmlns:q0="http://address.webservice"> 
?<q0:address> 
? <q0:province>Ontario</q0:province> 
? <q0:city>Toronto</q0:city> 
? <q0:street>123 Yonge St.</q0:street> 
? <q0:postalCode>12345</q0:postalCode> 
?<q0:phoneNumber> 
? <q0:area>416</q0:area> 
? <q0:prefix>567</q0:prefix> 
? <q0:number>1234</q0:number> 
? </q0:phoneNumber> 
? </q0:address> 
? </q0:echoAddress>

Gil, please have a look. We need to reconstruct some missing code in 
webserviceutils.jar to handle the serialization or deserialization of 
SOAPElements in a portable way.

Allan, I don't understand your reference in the summary to the Web Services 
Explorer. It doesn't deal in Java at all. How is SOAPElement relevant to it?
Sorry, it doesn't related to Web Services Explorer.
Added to Hot List at the request of Tim deBoer and setting priority to P2. Need a fix in 1.0.1.
Chris, can this be fixed in 1.0.1? Please target. Thx.

Targetting to 1.0.1, however, this is closer to a small enhancement than a defect as we will need to draft new utility methods (in webserviceutils.jar) to serialize and deserialize SOAPElements to and from XML documents. I'll assess it. If we cannot accomodate this, then a container-specific solution may be necessary.
*** Bug 120946 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Chris, please determine if a partial fix (no compile errors) is acceptable. Thx.

Created an attachment (id=32915)
Patch fix to org.eclipse.wst.ws.consumption

Allan, please try this patch. This is a tactical fix intended to keep the Sample JSP generator from producing incorrect code by, for now, recognizing SOAPElement as an explicitly unsupported type. Methods on the target Java bean that contain SOAPElements will be omitted from the generated JSPs. Meanwhile, we will continue working on proper support of SOAPElements in the JSPs.

Thanks - CB.

Allan, if you are self-hosting, you need to do an ant build on the plugin where webserviceutils.jar normally comes from.
Thanks for verifying, Allan. I've committed the patch and will release shortly. RFE bug 123963 is open to support SOAPElements in the Sample JSPs in WTP 1.5.
Released to HEAD and R1_0_maintenance, tag v20060116_1025.
